alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:29PM EST until January 09 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Cabarrus County in piedmont North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Several roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 921 PM EST, Rain gauge reported indicated rainfall totals of 3 to 4 inches over much of the area in the past 24 hours, and runoff of this recent heavy rainfall continues to produce flooding in much of Cabarrus County. Additional flooding is likely to develop along and near the Rocky River channel as the high water conditions move downstream. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg, Mt Pleasant, Midland and Charlotte Motor Speedway. - Flooding is most likely along the Rocky River above Irish Buffalo Creek west of Georgeville, and also along Rocky River locations downstream to the east and south. Flooding is likely occurring along Mount Pleasant Road, NC Route 200, and Bonanza Drive. Additional flooding will continue along the Dutch Buffalo Creek, impacting Bowman Barrier Road between Long Run Farm Road and the Mount Pleasant City Limits. Flooding may continue along Coddle Creek at Roberta Road as well as Clarke Creek near Harrisburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
